profile_positions.description:
I work at NS as test automator at the department DSO (Donna Service Organisation). Donna is a sceduling system for the capacity distribution of the Dutch Railways, a cooperation of NS and ProRail.

In an IT for IT team, we are responsible for:
- supporting the Scrum teams working on Donna,
- research and development for the architects of the Donna application,
- end-to-end tests for Donna.

I started as Test Automation Engineer at NS, but in the mean time I'm growing towards Software Engineer. I'm very excited about this opportunity to learn and grow in this nice company!
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description: Quality Time Group is a holding that consists of Eager, InQuisitive, and BQA. In the period that I did not have an assignment due to Corona, I started working for QTG as Software developer. I developed the ExamTrainer application - a tool to practice exams to receive a certificate. The goal is to take the application into use in September. A Product Owner, 4 developers and 2 testers form the ExamTrainer Scrum team. Since everyone is required to work from home (due to Corona), Teams is used as means of communication for, among other things, the standups and cooperation. The building of the ExamTrainer is done in Java 11 in IntelliJ, where the User Interface is build in JavaFX. All codes of the application are managed in Gitlab. The application is built according to the principle of OOP (Object Oriented Programming), because that way the application is easier expanded with new features. To start of, there is a differentiation between the front-end and the back-end. I quickly gained the skill to work with JavaFX, and in this way I enrolled as front-end developer. The UI screens are built according to the design of the Product Owner and the MVC model is applied to this. Within this model, the elements of UI screen, the data for that screen, and the executable code of the screen (such as linking the data to the UI elements or the action behind a button) are separated from each other. In that way, the code is clear and reusable. I have also been involved with the back-end, specifically to come up with ideas, code review, and core refactoring. From this a connectivity-layer arose, which functioned as a clear layer of communication between the front-end and back-end.  In this way it becomes clear where data needs to be requested or passed on, and the front-end and back-end developers can keep working without bothering each other. After a month, we have delivered the first version in package-form, solved bugs that were found by the tester, and given a demo.
profile_positions.title: Software developer

profile_positions.description:
InQuisitive is a secondment company for experienced software testers. I have joined the Coding Brigade to work on my programming skills and I got a certificate for AI and Software testing.

In the period that I work for InQuisitive I seconded at the following companies:
-Slachtofferhulp Nederland (Utrecht)
profile_positions.title: Softwaretester en Test Automation Engineer

profile_positions.description: I was hired by the CRIS team subsequently of the previous assignment at Slachtofferhulp due to to the demos I gave there. The CRIS application is the registration system of Slachtofferhulp. With this application, clients, conversations, and services are registered. I had the assignment to deliver a trustworthy, easy to maintain, automated regresssion-testset. The framework that was build for the ‘Online Platform’ team can be taken over and reused to the upmost extent. The main difference between the automation of tests for the ‘Online Platform’ team and the ‘CRIS’ team is that the CRIS application is built in iframes. This caused the locators to find web-elements to be different, but a stable and clear solution was found for this problem. In addition we have discovered that the CRIS application functions properly, which means it is not necessary to rerun tests when they fail. Finally, I have thought about efficient test scenarios and managing the high quantities of variables. As a result, the test framework has a clear design and is an easy maintainable whole. Due to the Corona pandemic, the budget for the CRIS team was tightened, which unfortunately led to the decision to temporarily stop and finish the project. Because of this and the size of the CRIS application, we could only automate a small fraction of the regression testset. It is a team of Exact Synergy consultants and application administrators without much knowledge regarding programming. Nevertheless, the transference of the project to the team went over well.
profile_positions.title: Seconded from InQuisitive - Test Automation Engineer for the CRIS team

profile_positions.description: Slachtofferhulp Nederland is a government agency that helps victims through emotional support, support in the criminal trial and which offers help with obtaining compensation. I am, together with an Eager colleague, hired as test automation engineer by the product owner of the 'Online Platform' Scrum team. This team is responsible for the website (https://www.slachtofferhulp.nl/). We have received the assignment to deliver an automated, trustworthy and maintainable regression testset. The automation of the regression tests was done in Visual Studio with MS Test in the programming language C#. To make sure the tests are trustworthy, a test framework gets installed which reruns tests that failed initially. Additionally, a dynamic waiting function has been used, to ensure that the flow only continues if the website has loaded completely. Extent Reports yield a clear report of where all testcases, teststeps and parameters are described, including their status (succeeded, failed, info, warning). Tags have been added to find an overview, per feature or per browser, of how many testcases have succeeded and failed. At the end of the assignment, the automated testset runs in the pipeline every night. We have transferred our work to the team so that they can manage and expand it themselves. The transference of the product, I did assertively and step by step; by informing the team during the creation-process, instead of afterwards when everything was finished, we received feedback early on and the team immediately benefited. Additionally, demos were given with the review, the daily standup was participated in, and a manual for making new test cases was written up. During the rounding up of the assignment, every wish was fulfilled and the team was very satisfied with the trustworthy additional feedback they received daily on their developments to the online platform.
profile_positions.title: Seconded from Eager - Test Automation Engineer for the Online Platform team

profile_positions.description:
Eager is a secondment company for starting software testers. I have participated on a Masterclass software testing, after which I have developed further in test automation, programming skills and Agile working. In the period that I worked for Eager, I have been seconded at the following three companies: 
-Zorg van de zaak (Utrecht)
-TataSteel Nederland (IJmuiden)
-Slachtofferhulp Nederland (Utrecht)
profile_positions.title: Softwaretester

profile_positions.description: In the period that I was working for Eager, I founded the Staff Association Eager and I was the chairman for two years. As chairman, I mostly paid attention to recruiting members, creating support amongst the members for the organisation of activities and bringing structure to the organisation. The goal of the organisation is to increase the contact between colleagues, as you do not get to see your seconded colleagues very often. The recruiting of members is a constant focus point within the organisation, because Eager is a company with a small number of employees which has a large flow.
profile_positions.title: Founder and chairman Staff Association Eager

profile_positions.description: Tata Steel - the 6th largest steel-company in the world - produces, machines, and distributes high value steel. I have been hired as softwaretester for the Scrum team, which was responsible for the communication software between the Tata Steel installations and the new planning system. The team had thought of CPC (Core Process Control) as generic part of the product line in order to prevent code duplication and to easily maintain the communication with the installations. As softwaretester, I was responsible for making testplans and work out, automate, and execute the tests and keep them working. The code I have build with C# in Visual Studio, just like the developers. The assignment required a high degree of abstract thinking. I came across lots of different concepts that I had to understand quickly, such as a product line, services, domain models, REST API requests, dependency injection, and inversion of controle. I have build an automated testset for both the back-end (API) and the front-end (UI). The back-end tests I did with the help of SpecFlow and the UI tests I did with SpecFlow and Selenium. I have taken care of a clear structure of the test projects to keep it a maintainable whole. I have also delivered documentation for the test projects and written a quick start guide for both the back-end and the front-end tests. Since every installation was places in a separate solution and worked together with other installations, my code was put in multiple solutions, all the while executing chain testing. At the end of every sprint, the delivered product was of higher quality and considerably less critical bugs were found. The bugs could also be solved distinguishably quicker. At the end of the assignment,  I have transferred my test responsibilities to my successor.
profile_positions.title: Seconded by Eager - Softwaretester and Test Automation Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Zorg van de Zaak is a network of companies that focus on health and safety services. Together with my Eager colleague, I got the assignment to build a regression test for the application Zorg  van de Zaak Online - a portal for employers to register absenteeism of their employees. One of the obstacles was that all knowledge was in the heads of the ICT-team members, there was no documentation available at the moment. That is why this assignment required tight collaboration with the ICT-team. In consultation with the functional designer, we decided what was supposed to come in the regression test and what the necessary coverage was supposed to be. Subsequently, they have elaborated and worked out the regression test and executed it manually. Findings were enacted in Jira. 
From late December 2017 onwards, I have started automating the regression test in C# with Selenium Webdriver, with the goal not to be obligated to this manually constantly, as well as to create a sustainable, easy to understand and maintainable regression test set. Finally, we have written an elaborate and clear documentation regarding the setup of the automatic regression test set. 

The final result were releases of better quality (less bugs) and an automated, sustainable and easily maintainable regression test. Because of the approach - the consultation with the functional designer -, the regression test was successfully set up with the desired coverage. Due to the elaborate and clear documentation regarding the setup  and the automatic regression test, the automatic regression test set became easy to maintain. 

Update April 2020: the automated regression test set has been maintained by the developers and is still successfully in use.
profile_positions.title: Seconded by Eager - Softwaretester, test automation engineer

profile_positions.description: Ekoplaza is a biological supermarket branch which only has products that are 100% biologically checked. They offer their farmers, growers, and producers a fair price for these products. I  have worked as shop assistant during my gap year. I was responsible for checkout operations, filling up products, opening, closing and cleaning the store, advising customers about the 100% biological assortment and the taking care of advertisement displays and promotional material in a creative manner.
profile_positions.title: Side job - Shop assistant

profile_positions.description: As tutor I have tutored secondary school students during my own secondary school and university education. I tutored students of all grades and education levels. I have primarily tutored in math A, B, C, physics, chemistry, and biology. When a student needed tutoring for other subjects as well, I jumped in and helped where I could.
profile_positions.title: Side job - Tutor

profile_positions.description: For the guidance of laptop-lectures and work-lectures of the bachelor course, enthusiastic students were sought-after. The subject Object-Oriented Programming is part of the bachelor course Artificial Intelligence. In this subject, you learn Object-Oriented Programming in the Java-language. As teaching assistant, I had to prepare assignments, guide students during the meeting, give feedback and judge their work. It was important to have enough knowledge of the subject, to make sure I could enthusiastically deliver the teaching material and offer the proper help to the students.
profile_positions.title: Side job - Teaching assistant object-oriented programming

profile_positions.description: For the guidance of laptop-lectures and work-lectures of the bachelor course, enthusiastic students were sought-after. The subject Logical Programming and Search-Techniques is part of the bachelor course Artificial Intelligence. In this subject, you learn to think logically, recursion, and programming in the Prolog language. As teaching assistant, I had to prepare assignments, guide students during the meeting, give feedback, and judge their work. It was important to have enough knowledge of the subject, to properly and enthusiastically deliver the teaching material and offer proper help to the students.
profile_positions.title: Side job - Teaching assistant Logical Programming and Search-techniques

volunteer_experiences.description: RACE-KIDS is een stichting, opgericht door mijn vader, met als doel kinderen en hun ouders te laten genieten van samen motorrijden en sportief racen. Ze beschikken over een kindvriendelijk begeleidingsteam en een uitgekiend opleidingstraject. Ik heb vroeger met mijn broertje zelf deze sport bedreven en toen ik het op een van de Race-Kids dagen het weer eens probeerde bleek het nog goed te kunnen. Mijn vader vroeg me of ik vrijwillig voor de stichting wilde werken als trainer op de baan. Dat hield in dat ik met de kinderen samen ging rijden en ze tussen de sessies door feedback gaf over hoe ze nog beter konden worden. Met mijn ervaring als bijlesdocent en passie voor motorracen paste dit goed in mijn straatje. Wanneer ik de tijd heb ga ik nog steeds mee naar de Race-Kids dagen als trainer.

Als vrijwilliger op evenementen heb ik me ingezet voor ProVeg Nederland. Ik heb hiervoor een training "donateurswerving" gevolgd. Op de evenementen heb ik donateurs geworven, geholpen met opbouwen en afbouwen, garderobe- en kassawerkzaamheden bij de toegang, programmaboekjes en hapjes uitgedeeld en feedback verzameld van de bezoekers over het evenement.

Voor een aantal dagen heb ik me ingezet op de actiedagen van Serve the City te Dordrecht. Hierbij hebben we eenzame ouderen geholpen bij lastige huishoudelijke taken, zoals de ramen zemen, een groot, druk, arm gezin geholpen met het schilderen van een ruimte in hun huis, samengewerkt met RestoVanHarte en vele andere goede acties om de buurt te helpen.
